definition: it's just perfect/it's just right
exactly/just
to (a place)/until (a time)/up to/to go/to arrive/(verb complement denoting completion or result of an action)
to be fond of/to have a tendency to/to be prone to
good/well/proper/good to/easy to/very/so/(suffix indicating completion or readiness)/(of two people) close/on intimate terms/(after a personal pronoun) hello
to reside/to live/to dwell/to be in/to be situated at/to stay/to get along with/to be in a position of/to deal with/to discipline/to punish
place/location/spot/point/office/department/bureau/respect/classifier for locations or items of damage: spot, point

sentences.english: His speech struck a perfect balance between humor and seriousness.
sentences.chinese: 他的演说把幽默性和严肃性的方寸掌握得恰到好处。

sentences.english: A basin of charcoal fire of proper heat will be the key to Yao's work in the afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 一盆烧得恰到好处的炭火，是姚贵文下午工作的关键。

sentences.english: The first taste is almost sweet, a rush of fruit giving way to a smooth sensation with just enough acid backbone.
sentences.chinese: 初尝口味偏甜，一抹果味赋予了她恰到好处的酸度。

sentences.english: Her little shoes now fitted her smartly.
sentences.chinese: 她的小鞋子穿来恰到好处。

sentences.english: You are the point of golden section in my life, loving me to the perfect degree.
sentences.chinese: 你是我生命中的黄金分割点，恰到好处的爱着我。

sentences.english: Learn to be mischievous and coquetry.
sentences.chinese: 学会恰到好处地撒娇调皮。

sentences.english: Super-ripe fruit, silk-like tannins and good acidity linger on the palate.
sentences.chinese: 蕴含醇熟的果味口感，单宁丝滑，酸度恰到好处。

sentences.english: The skin fried to perfection, crispy golden and the meat is tender.
sentences.chinese: 皮炸的恰到好处，金黄色的脆皮和软嫩的肉。

sentences.english: It is just fine to put the ellipsis at the end of the article.
sentences.chinese: 删节号用在这篇文章的末尾，恰到好处。

sentences.english: I found his speech wholly apposite to the current debate.
sentences.chinese: 我认为他的讲话对当前的辩论是恰到好处的。

sentences.english: He often sets the table a-roaring with a well-placed bon mot.
sentences.chinese: 他经常以恰到好处的珠玑妙语使满桌的人哄堂大笑。

sentences.english: The situation of the house was good.
sentences.chinese: 房子的位置选得恰到好处。

sentences.english: Her eye appears small and of the correct almond shape and is set very correctly into her skull.
sentences.chinese: 小小的杏仁眼恰到好处地嵌在头骨中。

sentences.english: It features intense fruit aromas in harmony with slight mint and anise notes.
sentences.chinese: 浓郁的果香与丝丝薄荷和茴芹味道协调得恰到好处。

sentences.english: That Caroline ran after a man was hit off by Linda.
sentences.chinese: 琳达把卡罗琳追求一名男子的情况描绘得恰到好处。

sentences.english: We approached the confluence at the perfect speed.
sentences.chinese: 我们以恰到好处的速度来到汇流处。

definition: (idiom) appropriate/apt/just right
ingenious/clever/ingenuity/artifice
to grasp/(dialect) affecting shyness/coy/to create difficulties
lit. extreme saturation (idiom)/fig. vividly and thoroughly/in great detail/without restraint/(of a performance) brilliant
perfect/perfection/perfectly
to bring out the best in each other (idiom)/to complement one another well
exquisite/meticulous
the brush stroke that dots in the eyes (idiom); fig. to add the vital finishing touch/the crucial point that brings the subject to life/a few words to clinch the point
appropriate/suitable
excellent in every respect/flawless
squeaky clean/neat and tidy/efficient
grace/graceful
to resemble nature itself/of the highest quality (idiom)
ample/complete/hundred percent/a pure shade (of some color)
to paint a dragon and dot in the eyes (idiom); fig. to add the vital finishing touch/the crucial point that brings the subject to life/a few words to clinch the point
gentle/soft
